definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
Shijing, the Book of Songs, early collection of Chinese poems and one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1]
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Poetry prophecy is an exotic flower in remote mountains which is in full bloom in our Chinese classics hundred-flower garden.
sentences.chinese: 詩讖是盛開在中國古典文學百花園裏的一株深山奇葩。

sentences.english: The so - called poet ground out some verses.
sentences.chinese: 這個所謂的詩人搜索枯腸做成幾句詩。

sentences.english: She can recite the long poem from the beginning to the end.
sentences.chinese: 她能把那首長詩從頭到尾地背下來。

sentences.english: He opened the inkstand to write a poem.
sentences.chinese: 他打開墨水瓶去寫一首詩。

sentences.english: Illustrated poetry is the artistic integration of Chinese poetry and painting .
sentences.chinese: 題畫詩，是中國詩歌與中國繪畫相互融合的藝術結晶。

sentences.english: Martin recollected his blank-verse tragedy, and sent it instead.
sentences.chinese: 馬丁想起了他的素體詩悲劇，便把它寄去充數。

sentences.english: Lu You was a famous patriotic poet in the Southern Song Dyansty .
sentences.chinese: 陸游詩南宋著名的愛國詩人。

sentences.english: Judges 5 is also another ancient song fragment in verses four to five.
sentences.chinese: 士師記》5中也有古老歌謠的片段，詩4和。

sentences.english: Chairman of Kincline Poetry Society in 1993.
Therefore, "Poems"has certain influence on the Mohist school thinking formation of politics.
sentences.chinese: 《詩》對墨家政治思想的形成產生了一定的影響。

sentences.english: He improvised a poem at the evening party.
sentences.chinese: 他在晚會上現編了一首詩。

sentences.english: The poem employs as its first lines a verse plagiarized from a billboard .
sentences.chinese: 這首詩開頭的幾行抄襲了一個廣告牌上的一節詩。

sentences.english: The other two poems were suggested by my wife; both of us like these two poems.
sentences.chinese: 另外兩首詩是我內人提議的，我們倆都喜歡這兩首詩。

sentences.english: He finally pumped up a poem to express his love for her.
sentences.chinese: 他終於寫出了一首詩，表達他對她的愛情。

sentences.english: In his teaching, Confucius attached great importance of "Songs".
sentences.chinese: 在孔門教學中，孔子對《詩》尤爲重視。

sentences.english: Tao Yuanming's poem has the characteristics that the wine and the chrysanthemum are fragrant.
sentences.chinese: 陶淵明詩具有酒香與菊香的特點。

definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
